body: Thanks to @Xekyo for suggesting this in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20305#discussion_r520234818.
Idea: since this is per-wallet, return the name of the wallet in the responses.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #20286 (rpc: deprecate `addresses` and `reqSigs` from rpc outputs by mjdietzx)
* #20012 (rpc: Remove duplicate name and argNames from CRPCCommand by MarcoFalke)
* #19735 (Fix -Wtautological-constant-out-of-range-compare warnings on 32-bit systems by hebasto)
* #19602 (wallet: Migrate legacy wallets to descriptor wallets by achow101)
* #16795 (rpc: have raw transaction decoding infer output descriptors by instagibbs)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
In the 'Successful responses' and 'Error responses' above shouldn't it be `sat/vB` instead of `sat/B`?

@prayank23 thanks for looking. Those will be automatically updated from sat/B to sat/vB by #20305, which updates the ToString() helper in `CFeeRate`. I updated the PR descpription to clarify that (thanks!)

diff_hunk:
@@ -107,7 +107,7 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert_equal(stats[self.max_stat_pos]['height'], self.start_height + self.max_stat_pos)
 
         for i in range(self.max_stat_pos+1):
-            self.log.info('Checking block %d\n' % (i))
+            self.log.info('Checking block %d' % (i))

body: The second argument of the cfeerate constructor is size_t (number of bytes), not CAmount (number of satoshis). Instead of adding more calls to the confusing constructor, I'd prefer to add a new constructor that takes in a univalue feerate as sat/b. I think this has also been provided as feedback when this code template was initially introduced.

body: Good idea, done in 9c479bfc293fec906 and proposed a refactoring in 392495bc4d9648fe0c28d that can be dropped
Oops, adding the CFeeRate UniValue ctor caused a circular dependency.

Hm, bringing the RPC utilities and UniValue into CFeeRate seems like a layer violation (and caused a circular dependency). Maybe a CFeeRate ctor that takes a CAmount + FeeEstimateMode instead of UniValue.
Updated the new CFeeRate ctor to take `(CAmount fee_rate, FeeEstimateMode mode)` and added unit tests.
Added more unit test coverage per `git diff 14c5e50 2176a3`.
